Summarising simsum objects

Source: R/summary.simsum.R
summary.simsum.Rd

The summary() method for objects of class simsum returns confidence intervals for performance measures based on Monte Carlo standard errors.

# S3 method for simsum
summary(object, ci_level = 0.95, ...)

Arguments

object

An object of class simsum.
ci_level

Significance level for confidence intervals based on Monte Carlo standard errors. Ignored if a simsum object with mcse = FALSE is passed.
...

Ignored.

Value

An object of class summary.simsum.

Note

Confidence intervals are constructed using quantiles from a normal distribution with the specified ci_level confidence level, and are therefore symmetric by definition.

See also

simsum(), print.summary.simsum()

Examples

data("MIsim")
object <- simsum(
  data = MIsim, estvarname = "b", true = 0.5, se = "se",
  methodvar = "method", mcse = TRUE
)
#> `ref` was not specified, CC set as the reference
xs <- summary(object)
xs
#> 
#> Call:
#> 	simsum(data = MIsim, estvarname = "b", true = 0.5, se = "se", 
#>     methodvar = "method", mcse = TRUE)
